title: File Permissions
content:
Permission bits

Permissions are defined for three classes:

  • user (u): owner
  • group (g)
  • other (o): everyone else

And three actions:

  • read (r)
  • write (w)
  • execute (x)

Reading ls -l output

ls -l
# -rw-r--r--  1 user group  123 Jan 01 12:00 file.txt
# drwxr-xr-x  3 user group   96 Jan 01 12:00 dir

Execute on directories

On directories, x means you can traverse (enter) the directory. Without x, you cannot access files inside, even if you can list names.
